She hopes to make a monthly profit of 50.000FCFA, which she plans to use to pay the interests of the Soro loan, to participate in the payment of the family expenses and to invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and has one child. She is running a business that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her business, such as maize and machine-milled rice. She opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Eva is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize and machine-milled rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to repair boats.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven muy trabajador, para salir adelante trabaja en un empresa de su ciudad como seguridad, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar su gastos de manutención.

Edwin esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una moto, con la cual podrá movilizarse y de esta manera no gastar mucho dinero en trasporte y poder ahorrar para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle a sus hijos una profesion”.
texts.en:
Edwin's a hardworking young man who gets ahead by working security for a business in his city.  He's able to support himself with what he earns.

Edwin's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because he'll be able to buy a motorcycle thanks to their help.  This way he'll be able to get around without spending a lot of money on transportation.  He'll also be able to save money so he can realize his big dream of paying for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Tharom

texts.en:
Tharom (picture here) is single, age 22, lives with her parents, brother, and sister in the suburb of Phnom Penh.
 
Tharom has been working in a mini-mart for a year. She wants to study accounting at the university, that’s why she decided to apply to pay school fees. She will use money from the loan to pay for her first year.

Credit to study bachelor's degree in Cambodia: There are four years, and divided into two semesters each year; first and second semester. And students can prefer to pay the school fees by the year or the semester, depending on the school or university's privacy policy.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Malin

texts.en:
Malin (picture here) is single, age 18, lives with her parents, brother, and sister in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Malin just finished her baccalaureate, and she wants to continue her bachelor's degree in accounting at the university. Hence, she has decided to apply for a loan to pay her school fees.

Credit to study bachelor's degree in Cambodia: There are four years, and divided into two semesters each year, first and second semester. And students can prefer to pay school fees by the year or the semester, depending on the school or university's privacy policy.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Sokunthea, aged 43, is a tailor. She lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has two children, one son and one daughter. Her daughter is married and her son is a garment worker. Her husband is a construction worker.  

Sokunthea is asking for a loan to buy additional fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ricarte

texts.en: Ricarte is a very hardworking person. He makes sure that he can meet the daily needs of his family. To increase his income, he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and additional piglets for his hog raising business. Ricarte hopes that in the future he can improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets for his hog raising business

loans.name: Vesna

texts.en:
Vesna, aged 29, has been married since 2004. She lives in a village about 22 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has two young children. She buys and sells Lies (small freshwater clams) in her village. Her husband is a porter.

Vesna is asking for a loan to build a restroom for her family because she does not have a proper one.

loans.use: to build a restroom.

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en:
Srey Mom (in the photo) lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. She has three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a soldier. 

Srey Mom had asked for a Kiva loan to buy a motorcycle for her son. She now wants to buy one more motorbike for her son to drive to the university. Hence, she decides apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to the university.

loans.name: Mealea

texts.en:
Mealea (in the photo) is a widowed mother with two children; one son and one daughter. She lives with her parents and brother on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh city. 

Her son is a garment worker and her daughter works for a hotel. Mealea is a weaver. 

She asked for a loan to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene, 49 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She has been working as a security officer in a garage at a private firm. Her husband works as a sentry at a high school. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repairs. 

She is requesting a loan of MNT 8,000,000 to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, she will repair and insulate her house thus creating a comfortable and warm place. Also the family will begin to burn less coal for heating and release less pollutants into the atmosphere. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Analita

texts.en:
Analita is 48 years old and lives in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental in Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Analita works in the fishing industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase a fishing boat.

Analita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Analita hopes to have more savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 47 years old and is engaged in hog fattening and fish vending as a sources of income. 

She was blessed with seven children. The two eldest are helping her in the improvement of their living through working as sales ladies. However, the income generated from their sources is not enough to cover the expenses of a big family. It requires a lot of sacrifices and hard work to earn sufficient income. She hopes to increase her sales but a shortage of funds obstructs her. 

She therefore seeks additional capital in the form of loan. Lorna hopes that her PHP 5,000 loan request will be approved so that she is able to purchase feed and vitamins for her current pigs, and fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for  her current pigs and fish to sell

loans.name: Aleyda

texts.es: Aleyda, a sus 45 años de edad es madre de tres hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo. Actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio, una panadería que inició para generar ingresos por cuenta propia, ya que vio la necesidad de estar al cuidado de sus hijos. Un cuñado le enseñó todo lo relacionado con la elaboración de los productos, debido a que ella no tenía ningún conocimiento sobre este tema; poco a poco fue aprendiendo y, de esta forma pudo sacar adelante su negocio, logrando que fuera reconocido en el barrio donde está ubicado. Además de ofrecer productos de panadería, también vende mecato y productos lácteos, generando los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar, mientras le dedica más tiempo a sus hijos. El crédito que solicita actualmente, lo desea invertir en la compra de activos fijos (vitrina enfriadora, ventilador) y surtido al por mayor (mecato y productos lácteos), de esta forma podrá mejorar la exhibición de los productos lácteos y tener más variedad disponible, lo que aumentará las ventas y sus ingresos. Aleyda sueña con progresar en su negocio y poder ofrecer nuevos productos que tengan buena acogida entre sus clientes, así tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar notablemente la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Aleyda, age 45, has three children.  She is the head of the household since she separated from her husband.  She currently tends to her business, a bakery that she started in order to generate income on her own.  She did this because she saw the need to take care of her children.  

A brother-in-law taught her everything having to do with making the products.  This is because she did not have any knowledge about this subject.  She was learning little by little.  This way she was able to get her business ahead.  She managed to be known in the neighborhood where she is located.  In addition to selling bakery products, she also sells pastries and dairy products.  This generates the income she needs to pay for the household’s basic necessities.  

She wishes to invest in the purchase of fixed assets (cooling case and fan) and wholesale stock (pastries and dairy products).  This way she will be able to improve the display of her dairy products, and she will have more variety available.  This will increase the sales and her income.

Aleyda dreams of progressing with her business and of being able to offer new products that will be well received among her customers.  This way she will have the opportunity to notably improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fixed assets (cooling case and fan) and wholesale stock (pastries and dairy products).

loans.name: Saruul

texts.en:
Mrs. Saruul, 38 years old, lives with her two daughters in an old house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a cook in a restaurant for three years. Her two daughters both go to high school. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, and it needs some serious repair. 

So, she is requesting a loan of 8,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials, such as bricks, planks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she will repair and insulate her house, creating a comfortable and warm place where her family will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the atmosphere. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en:
Mrs. Tserendulam, 38 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an apartment. She and her husband have been selling meat to local people since 2000, and accumulated a vast amount of experience in preserving meat and selling it. Their children go to high school. 

They live in the lowest floor of the apartment, and as winter is coming closer, she wants to renovate her home. So she is requesting a loan of 8,000,000 MNT to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, she wants to repair and insulate her home. 

The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass, and foam to repair and insulate her home before winter.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie has been engaged in the hog raising business for ten years. Aside from hog raising, she also cultivates 1.5 hectares of rice field. Rosemarie is now 56 years old, widowed and has been blessed with four children.Three of her children are working, while her youngest child still attends school.

Hog raising is her family's main source of income. Rosemarie would like to increase the number of pigs she raises and this is the reason she is asking for a loan of PHP 22,000.T his loan will be used to purchase one piglet and livestock feed. She hopes that lenders will grant her the requested loan in order to keep her hogs healthy and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase one piglet and livestock feed

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
Ederlina has operated her store and eatery for 34 years. She is now 55 years of age, and married with three children. Her main goal is to increase the income she earns so she will not rely on her children's help when she gets weak. 

At this time, only her youngest child attends school. In order to achieve her goals, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000, which allows her to buy grocery items and raw vegetables for her store and eatery business. 

Ederlina believes that she can improve her financial stability through hard work and initiative in running her store and eatery.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and raw vegetables for her store and eatery business

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 35-year old, hard working, housewife. She lives in Punjab Pakistan with her husband and four children. For the past 4 years, her husband drives a taxi at night. But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. He wants to repair it as soon as possible as this is the only source of income for his family.

To help him, Robina has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to meet the costs of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in future. Robina hopes to provide quality education to all her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business . She is very much thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: For the maintannce of taxi engine.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo tiene 38 años y nació en la capital colombiana. Para financiar sus estudios de Historia en la universidad trabajó como editor en una pequeña publicación virtual sobre ingeniería de procesos industriales. Vive con su madre, quien es ama de casa y a quien apoya económicamente.

Rodolfo tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría en estudios sobre Rusia y Europa centro-oriental. Para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, ya que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos de exámenes de idioma y aplicación a las universidades.

Esta es su historia:

Terminé mi pregrado con un gran esfuerzo, lo que me implicó trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo. Durante este tiempo pude mantenerme entre los primeros diez promedios académicos de la carrera. Mis responsabilidades financieras y materiales incluyen la manutención mía y de mi señora madre, el pago de un crédito educativo al ICETEX y de otras obligaciones con bancos. 

Soy un apasionado por la Historia y por un área de estudio específica: Rusia y Europa centro-oriental.  Creo firmemente que el avance y el progreso de un país no solo debe tener en cuenta la preparación de expertos en áreas que generen riqueza material —ingenierías, tecnologías de punta, economía, finanzas, entre otras—, sino también incluir aquellas que cultiven y fomenten la generación del acervo intelectual y cultural como las humanidades, tanto en el conocimiento de lo nuestro como de lo hecho por otros pueblos y culturas. Por ello, una formación sólida como la que pretendo lograr y la difusión de este aprendizaje en el ámbito colombiano pueden contribuir con este propósito.  Estoy seguro de que en el 2014 estaré en Europa haciendo mi maestría.

Kiva me ofrece una gran oportunidad para acercarme a esta meta, especialmente porque mis recursos económicos no son abundantes. Además, recientemente mi trabajo ha dejado de ser estable, lo que crea incertidumbre en mi estabilidad económica y mis ingresos. Por ello, espero que consideren mi caso y tengan a bien prestarme su apoyo. 

Cuando regrese a Colombia después de terminar la maestría, tengo el sueño de vincularme al sector académico y a la investigación, con el propósito de compartir y difundir el conocimiento adquirido y, de esa manera, estrechar lazos de amistad entre ambas regiones.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, 38, was born in the capital of Colombia. He worked as the editor of a small online publication on industrial engineering to pay for his college history program. He lives with and financially supports his mother, who is a homemaker. Rodolfo dreams of obtaining a masters in Russian and Central-eastern European studies. The only way he can pay for the language test and the university application to enter the program is to apply for a Kiva loan. 

Rodolfo tells his story:

"I worked hard to finish my undergraduate program, working and studying at the same time. I was able to support myself during the first ten academic semesters of the program. I was financially and materially responsible for both myself and my mother, my student loan at ICETEX, and other bank loans. I love history, specifically Russian and central-eastern European history. I strongly believe that a country's advancement and progress should include preparing experts not only in fields that generate material wealth—engineering, advanced technology, economics, finance, and others— but also fields like humanities that promote the intellectual and cultural riches and knowledge of our society as well as others. A solid foundation like the one I hope to achieve and spreading what I learned throughout Colombia could help me contribute to this proposition. I'm certain that I will be studying for my masters in Europe in 2014.  

Kiva is providing a great opportunity to achieve my goal, especially since I don't have much money and lately my job has not been stable. This has made my financial situation and my income uncertain. So I hope you will lend me your support. After I finish the masters and return to Colombia, I hope to work in academia and research so that I can share and spread the knowledge I acquired and create friendships in both countries."

loans.use: to pay application fees for the masters program in Russian and Central European studies.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea (in the photo) is a weaver, and lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Her husband is a musician. He wants to supplement with a new business, driving a moto kangbei. In the past, these were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

With the new business, Kunthea’s husband will earn extra income to better support his standard of living. Hence, Kunthea decided to apply for a loan to buy a kangbei for her husband.

loans.use: to buy a kangbei (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi) for her husband.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is from Ponong, Larena, Siquijor. She is 56 years old and a widow with 4 children who are in school and adults. 

In 2012, Anita applied her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing, and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Anita is asking for financial assistance of PHP 40,000 to buy bags, clothes, shoes, and pants for her "ukay-ukay" (clothing) business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income more, and be of help in the expansion of her business. 

She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy bags, clothes, shoes, and pants.

loans.name: Luis Orlando

texts.es:
Luis es un joven dedicado a la fabricación de muebles para el hogar, sus diseños han hecho crecer la demanda de sus productos, por esta razón Luis necesita comprar herramientas modernas y oportunas para cumplir con dicha demanda y mejorar el acabado de sus artículos, solicita un crédito por un millón cuarenta mil colones (¢1.040.000), al igual que 
muchos beneficiarios agradece la oportunidad de financiamiento agil y muy oportuna.
texts.en: Luis is a young man and makes a living producing furniture for the home.  His much liked designs have seen a growth in demand for his products and so Luis needs to buy necessary and modern tools.  With these tools he can keep up with demand and improve his products.  Luis is applying for a loan of 1,040,000 Colon.  Luis is grateful for this timely and flexible financial support.

loans.use: to buy tools to make furniture.

loans.name: Eliécer

texts.es: Eliécer es padre de dos niños trabaja durante la semana en una empresa a diez kilómetros de su casa, los fines de semana alquila una motocicleta para laborar como mensajero en algunos restaurantes de su comunidad, ya que necesita obtener más ingresos, él necesita comprar una motocicleta para trabajar y usarla para transportarse al trabajo, para lo cual está solicitando un millón cuarenta mil colones (¢1.040.000)
texts.en: Eliécer has two children and works during the week at a business located ten kilometers from his house. He rents a motorcycle on weekends to deliver for some local restaurants to earn more money. He needs to buy a motorcycle to use for work and getting to work, so he has applied for a loan of 1,040,000 CRC.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una señora muy esforzada y  trabajadora, necesita continuar con su negocio de venta de productos por catálogo, ya que de los ingresos que le genera  esta actividad depende su sustento diario. Debido a la época que se acerca las ventas crecen,  por lo que necesita también comprar más productos, por lo cual solicita un crédito por un millón de colones (¢1.000.000
texts.en: María is a determined, hardworking woman. She needs to sustain her catalog sales business, as she supports herself with the income it generates. She needs to buy more merchandise for this season when sales rise, so she has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 CRC.

loans.use: to buy catalog merchandise to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat, a widowed mother, lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a rice farmer. 

Yat wants to buy a motorcycle for her grandchild to drive to school, but she does not have money. Hence, she decided to ask for a loan to make the purchase.

Photo: Yat and her daughter were together on disbursement day.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her grandchild to drive to school.

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 49-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life.

Her husband owns a general store where he sell a variety of materials which include flour, rice, sugar, biscuits, bread, eggs, etc. His monthly net income is inadequate to meet the family needs, so he wants to increase the business so that he can easily increase his monthly net income. 

To help her husband, Nazeeran, as a member of three persons lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. 

He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of products. He will add more variety in his store that includes, noodles, cooking oils, juices, nestle water, etc. to offer more variety to his customers. This will help him to gradually increase his customers and monthly net income. 

Nazeeran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, cooking oils, juices, nestle water, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 70 years old and lives in Banisilon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is the breadwinner for her family and is able to provide for their daily needs. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. 

In need of additional working capital, Crispina decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 14,900 for buying farm and garden fertilizer and for paying labor costs for cultivating her family's land.

Crispina is very thankful because if it were not for PMPC, she might not have any savings nor be guided properly in her finances. Crispina hopes to get back redemptive pawn land someday to use for living.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for land preparation.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, age 51, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family and her husband works very hard, so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband sells sanitary goods, such as pipes, shower heads, PVC pipes, etc. in the main market. His net income is too low to meet the family's needs. Presently, the stock of his shop is depleted and he needs additional capital to purchase a variety of goods to sell. 

Therefore, to help her husband, Parveen, as a member of a three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan. Parveen's husband will use the loan to buy pipes, shower heads, plastic and PVC pipes to sell in his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business, so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Parveen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy pipes, shower heads, and plastic PVC pipes to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012. She appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000. This loan is intended to finance her farming activity.

Maria dreams of nothing more than having a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To finance her farming activity.

loans.name: Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Bello Amanecer está conformado por 10 integrantes siete mujeres y tres hombres, madres y padres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal.
En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos, y pasar tiempo con ellos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar una carrera, y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad. Por lo tanto luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus pequeños hijos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Juana y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, café, detergente, jabón, jugos, gaseosas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestible para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Bello Amanecer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Bello Amanecer Communal Bank is made up of ten members, seven women and three men, responsible mothers and fathers with twenty children in their care.  They're from El Sauce, located in the western area of the country, and are known as hardworking and responsible people who want to improve themselves.  They enjoy spending their free time with their children.  Unfortunately they were unable to study for a degree because they lacked financial resources and had to work from a young age.  They strive every day, however, to give their young children a better future.

Juana's the coordinator of the group thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead.  Her job is a "pulpería" located in her home.  A pulpería is a small store that sells small quantities of food such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, coffee, detergent, soap, juice, and soda.

The goal of Juana's loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling groceries so in the near future she can earn more income.

Bello Amanecer Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have a means to a decent job.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Triunfo está conformado por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables de sus familias. Ellos son originarios de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personas. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 

Gracias a su esfuerzo  y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Leyda y tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanía que vende productos como jarrones, comales, floreroros,adornos de cocina, cucharas, maseteras, actividad que dedica unas ochos horas diarias de forma ambulante y por encargo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de artesanía para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal El triunfo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Triunfo is made up of 9 members, 8 women and 1 man, mothers and fathers responsible for their families. They are originally from Malpaisillo which is located in the northern zone of the country. These people are characterized by being hard working, responsible, and wanting to excel. Unfortunately due to lack of economic resources they were not able to study and were obligated to work from a young age in order to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to the strength and determination to move forward, the coordinator, Leyda sells handicrafts where she sells products like vases, griddles, kitchen ornaments, spoons and flower pots. She does this work 8 hours daily on foot. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of handicrafts so that in the no too distant future she can obtain better income. The communal bank El Triunfo  appreciates the support of the Kiva investors that provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have a way to dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of handicrafts such as vases, clay houses, pots, griddles, spoons, jars and flower pots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair a boat and and to purchase fishing gear.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is married, with three children. She is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Felicidad is a farmer and grows flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer for land preparation.

Felicidad has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for seven years. In the future, Felicidad hopes to have a truck to deliver her flowers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for land preparation.

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Juan Francisco Evelio

texts.es:
Juan, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Anteriormente se dedicaba a realizar la labor de corte de madera y hace 11 años se dedico a cultivar maíz para la venta. La producción la vende a intermediarios en grano y en elote. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 10,000 Lempiras con el cual va cubrir gastos de mano de obra y compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. 
Su fin es incrementar la producción y mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en: Juan is 34 years old. He lives in a common law marriage with his partner with whom he has 4 children. They live in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. Previously he worked as a lumberjack and for the last 11 years he has worked growing corn to sell. He sells his harvest to intermediaries in grain form and by the cob. The loan he is seeking is part of his third cycle and it is for $500. With this loan he will cover the cost of manual labor and he will purchase fertilizers for the cultivation of corn. His goal is to increase his production and to improve the quality of life of his family

loans.use: to cover the expenses of manual labor and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn.

loans.name: Clarivel

texts.es: Clarivel de 30 años de edad habita en un municipio ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar,  con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 1 y 8 años.  Ella inició en la actividad comercial, desde hace 3 años vendiendo bebidas frías, ñame, queso, productos varios de la canasta familiar y venta de minutos de telefonía celular. Aprovechando el local de su esposo adicionó a su clientela una nueva oferta, pues compró una fotocopiadora para que sus clientes tuvieran la oportunidad de acceder a servicios de fotocopiaje y ganar ella un poco mas de dinero.   Su meta hoy es ampliar su negocio y para eso requiere adicionar una fotocopia mas, con la cual planea incrementar sus ventas, debido a que la actual es muy pequeña y no tiene mucha capacidad de producción, esta  es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una fotocopiadora, para conseguir el propósito planteado. En la actualidad maneja una liquidez de 2:1, indicador financiero desde el cual proyecta su crecimiento, con el financiamiento, pues su meta es mas adelante, tener una papelería y garantizar estudios de calidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Clarivel is 30 years old and in lives in a city located in the county of Bolívar with her spouse and their 2 children ages 1 and 8.  She started in business 3 years ago selling cold beverages, yams, cheese and other basic foods as well as cellphone minutes.  Taking advantage of her husbands store, she was able to offer her a new service.  She purchase a photocopier so her clients would have the ability to use her photocopying service and she could earn more money.

Her goal is to expand her business, for which she needs an additional photocopier, with which she plans to increase her sales since the one she has now is too small and doesn't have much output capacity. This is the reason why she is seeking a Kiva loan, which will be her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to purchase a photocopier that can serve its intended purpose.  

She currently manages a 2:1 liquidity, a financial indicator by which she projects her growth.  With the loan she will be able to grow more, open a stationary shop and guarantee quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Sampaguita

texts.en:
Sampaguita is 55 years old and lives in San Pedro district, Pagadian City. She is married and has six children.

Sampaguita has a Ready-To-Wear clothes business and earns approximately PHP12,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested this loan to be used as additional capital for her RTW business.

Sampaguita has been member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Sampaguita hopes to make her RTW store into a bigger one.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en: Franklin is 37 years old, married and blessed with two children. He is a tricycle driver in his family's village who dreams of providing a comfortable life for his family. His business is his only source of income. Franklin wants to increase his income by using this requested PHP 5,000 loan to purchase spare parts which he needs for his tricycle. By tirelessly working, he knows he can provide a better living conditions for his family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts needed for his tricycle.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 32 years of age and is a wife and a mother of three school-going children. She is also a business woman.

Mwanasiti sells fruits and vegetables in the local market. She has been in this business for the last four years and the business has been growing over the years. She knew Milango through friends and decided to join with an aim of saving and also accessing credit to fund her business. 

Mwanasiti now seeks a loan to buy more oranges, bananas, kales and cabbages for sale in her business. The major challenges in her business are bad debts and high transportation costs. She will use the extra income that she will raise to improve her standards of living and educate her children as well.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hamera's Group

texts.en:
Hamera is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a tailoring shop which is the only source of income for the family. He has excellent tailoring skills and his customers appreciate his services.  

Presently, Hamera's husband needs additional capital to purchase one more sewing machine to keep up with customer needs more professionally.  Hamera, as a member of this two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a sewing machine so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of this amount, he can put aside some savings to pay for electricity and gas.

Hamera hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ismenia

texts.es: Ismenia, tiene 46 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en la Masica, Atlántida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de plásticos. Hace 4 años vende medicinas naturales y presta el servicio de masajes. Ella ha obtenido 4 prestamos con ODEF  con el actual para poder mantener el negocio. Este préstamo es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de medicinas como ser vitaminas, pastillas de hiervas, tratamientos para la piel y otras enfermedades Y poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos. Su plan es ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Ismenia is 46 years old, and married with three children.  She lives in La Masica, Atlántida.  Previously, she was engaged in selling plastics.  For four years, she has been selling natural medicines and providing massage services.  She has received four loans from ODEF and with the current loan, she will be able to maintain her business.  This loan is for 10,000 Lempiras and she will invest it in the purchase of medicines such as vitamins, herbal pills, and treatments for the skin and other conditions. In this way, she will be able to offer her customers a variety of products.  Her plan is to help her family..

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines for sale.

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Naranchimeg is 43 years old and lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her children go to high school. She and her husband have been selling water containers to the local people since 2000. This business is the only income source on which the whole family depends.

The house Naranchimeg and her family live in has been deteriorated over the years so she is requesting a loan of 8,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam in order to make renovations to her house. As a result, the family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less smoke is released into air. The burning of coal is considered to be the main source of air pollution in Mongolia according to state research.

loans.use: renovate her house

loans.name: Apple Group

texts.en:
Amani, who is in his late 20s, is married and blessed with a baby boy.  Amani has been managing his family expenses by running a barber shop business for four years. He works from 8:00am to 9:00pm each working day and is able to earn a good monthly return.
 
This is Amani's second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy more barbershop equipment. He is looking forward to servicing more men in his shop. The previous loan, which he has paid back successfully, was used to add new business machines and other daily working equipment. Amani used his business profit to pay for his family food expenses and kept the remains in the bank. Amani dreams to open other branches and build a house.  

Amani will share this loan with his loan group "Apple"  which consist of 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita is married with 3 children. She is 40 years old and lives in Divisoria, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Enecita sells a variety of bananas to earn a living.  She has had this business for 17 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,500 doing this type of work. She requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to  purchase more bananas to sell. 

Enecita has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.  In the future, she hopes to have more savings for her children's future.

loans.use: buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane, aged 18, is a young mother.  She was not able to finish her education due to early marriage. As a result, she suffers difficulty in looking for a good job.  However, she didn't lose hope and started a small business that her family benefits from a lot.  She doesn't want to forever depend to her parents because she is already married. 

According to Diane, this activity is difficult but with her hard work and enough funds to sustain the needs of the hogs she will surely obtain satisfying income. The only problem is, she has no sufficient capital to use. Therefore, Diane requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feeds, vitamins, and one pig. She hopes that her requested loan will be provided so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: buy feeds, vitamins, and one pig

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a 45-year-old hard-working mother residing in Camogao, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. Lilibeth has 2 children who are in adults.  

Her wage isn’t enough to sustain the daily needs for her family, so Lilibeth started a business of a food stand making bread.  Lilibeth has been in this  business more than a year now. 

Lilibeth wants to expand her food stand business.  She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially her children, and she wants to be able to send her children to college. 

In order for Lilibeth to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 14,900 in additional capital and will use the money to expand her business.  She intends to buy flour, sacks of sugar, yeast, gallons of oil, baking soda and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed in her food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Ma. Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 53 years old and lives in Lower Pulacan, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur.  She is married and has five children.

Elvira is has a shop that sells food, softdrinks and other home daily needs. She has this business for one year. She requested a loan to purchase additional inventories to her sari-sari store.

Elvira has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Elvira hopes to make her retail store into a bigger grocery store.

loans.use: buy inventories for her store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a business woman and a mother of two school-going children. She has several businesses that she started two years ago. She has seen growth in her businesses over the past years and has been able to employ someone to help her run her businesses. 

Esther owns a money transfer business, a cosmetics shop and a chemist. The challenges that she has been facing over the years include seasons that sometimes cuts down her income. She knew Milango through friends and joined so that she can save and be able to access credit to fund her businesses.

Esther now seeks a loan to buy drugs and cosmetics to stock her businesses. She will use the extra income to improve her standards of living and also educate her children.

loans.use: buy drugs and cosmetics

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es casada, tiene 42 años de edad, tiene una pulpería en Puerto Cabezas desde hace 5 años, en la cual vende frutas, verduras y granos básicos.

Ha recibido financiamiento de Pana Pana desde hace 6 años, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante con sus hijos. Actualmente, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar más y nuevos productos para su pulpería, con el propósito de ir creciendo y que su vida se vaya transformando conforme a los ingresos que recibe de su negocio e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Felicita is 42 years old and married. She has had a corner store in Puerto Cabezas for 5 years where she currently sells fruit, vegetables, and staple goods.

She has received financing from Pana Pana for 6 years, which has allowed her to get ahead with her children. Currently, she is requesting a new loan to buy more and new products for her corner store with the purpose of growing so that her life will change as the income from her business does and she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more and new products for her corner store.

loans.name: Ariunjin

texts.en:
Ariunjin is 35 years old and lives with his wife and children in an old house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician at a power station since 1994 and accumulated a vast amount of experience in dealing with electricity related matters. His wife offers transportation service to local people using her microvan. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair, so Ariunjin is requesting a loan of 8,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as cements, bricks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he and his wife will repair and insulate their old house, thus creating warmer and more comfortable accommodations for their children. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release less pollutants into the atmosphere, contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: renovate his house

loans.name: Lkhagvadorj

texts.en:
Lkhagvadorj is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as consulting engineer at a mining company on temporary employment contract since 2012. His wife is unemployed and currently stays at home looking after household matters. Their daughters both go to high school. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair.  So Lkhagvadorj is requesting a loan of 8,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam to renovate his home. As a result, the family will burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere. The burning of coal is considered to be the main source of air pollution in Mongolia according to state research.

loans.use: renovate his house

loans.name: Saranchimeg

texts.en:
Saranchimeg is 48 years old and lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling furniture such as sofas and armchairs to local people by renting a stall at an outdoor market for seven years.  Last year she began a transportation business by buying a  minivan. Her husband transports coal between districts using his truck.  Before this, he had transported students to their schools by bus. 

The Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair. So Saranchimeg  is requesting a loan of 8,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass and foam to renovate her home. As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Becham Group

texts.en:
Veronica, who is in her early 20s, is married and has two boys who are still babies. For five years now Veronica has been managing her family by running a mamalishe business (restaurant). She cooks different type of food like rice with beans and meat, breakfast bites, stiff-porridge with meat, vegetables, fruits and other food. She works from 6:00am to 10:00pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month.

This will be Veronica's 5th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, Veronica restocked more food supplies in her mamalishe business (cooking oil, some kilos of sugar, baking flour, maize flour and rice). With the profit earned from  her business, she bought a plot of land and paid some portion of family expenses.  Veronica will use this loan to buy more food supplies to prepare more food. She dreams to build a house. 

Veronica will share this loan with her loan group "BECHAM" which consist of 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy food for her restaurant

loans.name: Mbuni Group

texts.en:
Rehema is in her mid 40s and is married with four children who are still going to school. She has been selling water, sodas, juice at wholesale price for six years now. She works from 7.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to sell cooking oil, which she used to collect from upcountry. She also sold cosmetics, water, juice and sodas which she sold at wholesale price. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, household expenses, bought a farm and started building her house. She will use this loan to buy a motorcycle for a transportation business. She dreams of finishing building her house.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group "Mbuni" which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for a transportation business.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима является повторной клиенткой ИМОНа. Она кредитуется 19 цикл. Фотима порядочная женщина и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Она родилась в 1959 году. Фотима замужем и имеет 4 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Фотима уже более 23 года работает в средней школе учителем. Она имеет огромный педагогический опыт работы. Среди коллег ее знают как умную, порядочную и интеллигентную женщину. Фотима не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы купить мебель для дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки мебели. Она нуждается в этой мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Fotima is a recurring client with IMON. She takes a loan for the 19th time. Fotima is a respectable woman and has a good credit history. She was born in 1959. Fotima is married and has four children. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. 

Fotima has worked as a high school teacher for more than 23 years already. She has great pedagogical experience from her work. Among her colleagues she is known as a smart, respectable and intelligent woman. 

Fotima does not have enough money to purchase furniture for her home. She requests a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni for the purchase of furniture. She needs this furniture and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 33-year-old married woman.  She is a mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Noor's husband owns a tailoring shop, which is the only source of income for the family. He has excellent tailoring skills and his customers appreciate his services. Presently, he needs additional capital to purchase one more sewing machine to keep up with customer needs more professionally. For that reason, Noor has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a sewing machine so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

With the help of more profit, Noor's husband can put aside some savings for the future. Noor hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ulfat

texts.en:
Ulfat is a 43-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband, three sons, and two daughters. Her husband's income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Ulfat is trying to help him fill their needs by stitching clothing. 

Since 2010 Ulfat has operated her tailoring business very efficiently, but she is currently in need of purchasing a new sewing machine, as her old machine is not working properly. To do that, she has requested a loan as a member of an eight-person group from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan so she can continue her business. With the profits she will pay the household expenses, put aside some savings, pay utility bills and open a new mobile shop for her elder son. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea, age 42, lives in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four children -- three sons and one daughter.  
 
Thea and her husband are farmers. When not at the farm, Thea also weaves at home and her husband does construction work.  

Thea is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her son to go to work.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Charya

texts.en:
Charya, age 26, is single and lives with her widowed mother in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a garment worker.    

Charya wants to buy a motorbike for commuting to work because she now must stay with a relative who lives near the garment factory that she works for.  With a motorbike, which she will buy with money from the loan, Charya can come back home when she leaves work every day and she does not need to stay with her relative any more.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Munkhgerel

texts.en:
Munkhgerel, 23 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been making and selling felt boots to local people since 2010. 

The family resides in old house on plot of land. The house her family lives in has deteriorated badly and she is requesting a loan of 8000000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fibreglass and foam to renovate her house. As a result, her family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and then less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
"Hard-working mother" best describes Liezl, who resides in New Society Culo, Molave Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Liezl is married and has 1 child. She a started a business, a food stand or “carenderia”,  for more than a year now. 

Liezl wants to expand her food stand business.  She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially so she would be able to send her child to college.  

In order for Liezl to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 7,000 of additional capital and will use the money to buy additional spices and ingredients for her business.  She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and other ingredients, and utensils and other things that are needed in her carenderia. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: buy food ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Джамила родилась в 1951 года. Она разведенная женщина. Ее муж бросил ее с 5 детьми и воспитанием детей она занимается сама. Джамила имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она начитанная и умная женщина. Джамила  более 37 лет работает в средней школе и несколько лет она работала в детском садике. Джамила хорошо воспитала своих детей. Ее дети работают в различных местах. Двое из ее сыновей находятся в  Российской Федерации. Они там подрабатывают на жизнь. Джамила серьёзно заболела, и ей срочно необходимо лечиться. Она не имеет денег, чтобы купить лекарства. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Jamila was born in 1951. She is divorced. Her husband left her with five children, and she had to raise them by herself. Jamila has higher pedagogical education. She is a well-read and smart woman. Jamila has worked in high school for more than 37 years, and she also worked some years at a kinder garden. 

Jamila raised her children well. Her children work in different places. Two of her sons live in the Russian Federation. There they earn money for their living. Jamila is seriously ill and needs to be treated urgently. She does not have the money to purchase medicine. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni to purchase medicine for treatment. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for treatment as she is seriously ill

loans.name: Cristian Alexis

texts.es:
Cristian, está casado tiene dos hijos de 10 y 7 años, con el viven sus padres de 80 y 90 años. Tiene  15 años administrando su granja de pollos; también ofrece el servicio de enderezado y pintura, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre. Los ingresos que el negocio le genera son utilizados para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, ya que todos dependen de él.
El capital lo invertirá en compra de pollos, concentrado, pintura y adhesivos; de esta forma ampliara su negocio y generar más ingresos, que le permitan mejorar las condiciones en las que por el momento tiene su granja.
Cristian, aspira ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de salud, alimentación y que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor sin limitantes en su educación.
texts.en: Cristian is married and he has two children who are 10 and 7 years old. His parents lives with him who are 80 and 90 years old. He has spent 15 years managing his chicken farm. He also offers repair and painting services, a job that he learned about from his father. His income from his businesses is used to cover the needs of his family because all of them depend on him. He will invest this loan in the purchase of chickens, feed, paints and adhesives. This way he will expand his business and increase his income which will allow him to improve the current condition of his farm. Cristian aspires to offer his family better food and health conditions and he wants his children to have a better future without limitations on the their education.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, paint and adhesives.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen, opta por un  nuevo crédito para incrementar el equipo de trabajo en su sala de belleza;  comprara dos planchas para planchar pelo y dos estantes para poner a la vista diferentes productos de belleza.
Ella invirtió el préstamo anterior en diversificar los productos de belleza que ofrecía a sus clientes. Tuvo incremento en sus ingresos, tiene local propio, mantiene sus clientes y han llegado nuevos.
Su situación económica ha cambiado hoy posee una vida familiar con mejor salud, alimentación adecuada sigue trabajando para ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en: Carmen is applying for a new loan to purchase more beauty salon equipment. She will purchase two hair irons and two shelves to display various beauty products.  She used the previous loan to diversify the beauty products that she offered to her customers.  She has her own business location, has increased her income, kept her customers, and gained new customers.  Her financial situation has changed.  Today, her family is in better health and has adequate food, and she continues working to further expand her business..

loans.use: to purchase two hair irons and two shelves.

loans.name: Mahmoona

texts.en:
Mahmoona has applied for a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to grow her garment business, which she has been running for the past two years. 

Mahmoona is a 24-year-old well-educated married woman with two sons and two daughters, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  She wants this financing so that she can provide better quality products to her clients, like pants, T-shirts, uniforms and all kinds of ladies and children garments.  This will allow her to increase her monthly savings as well.

Mahmoona is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one and will greatly help in the growth of her business.

loans.use: buy garments to sell

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya, age 57, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a petrol seller. He belongs to a poor family and this business is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs finance to purchase drums for petrol storage.

Therefore, Aliya is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Aliya hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase drums for petrol storage.

loans.name: Rotifakhon

texts.ru: Ротифахон трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 44 года. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Детям 21 и 18 лет. Недавно умер ее муж, который работал в Российской Федерации. Ее старший сын учится и работает в Российской Федерации, а второй сын учится в Таджикском Технологическом Университете. Ротифахон работает кассиром в организации. Она осталась без кормильца после смерти мужа и теперь все семейные расходы, Ротифахон должна оплатить сама. Она не имеет денег, чтобы оплатить за учебы второго сына. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Rotifakhon is a hardworking and cheerful woman. She is 44 years old. She is a widow and has two children. The children are 21 and 18 years old. Rotifakhon's husband, who worked in the Russian Federation, died not long ago. Her eldest son studies and works in the Russian Federation, and the other son studies at the Tajik Techological University. 

Rotifakhon works as a cashier for an organization. She was left without a breadwinner after the death of her husband. Currently Jamila needs to pay for all family expenses herself. She does not have the money to pay for the son's tuition. She requests a loan in the amount of 7,500 somoni to pay for her son's  tuition. She awaits your kindness and your charity.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education

loans.name: Sabikis

texts.en:
Sabikis runs a small stall which sells groceries, snacks and mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments. He lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Sabikisi is married.

Sabikis began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, he has had around $5 – $10 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

Recently, he took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Albaro Maikel

texts.es:
Albaro es un joven optimista, originario de la Ciudad de Bilwi, tiene 27 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres pequeños hijos que con gran entusiasmo asisten a la escuela.

Tiene ocho años de trabajar en el hospital de la Ciudad, lo que le ha permitido ir mejorando su nivel de ingresos y acceder a financiamiento de parte de Pana Pana. Actualmente, solicita un préstamo para la mejora de su vivienda, el cual será invertido en la división de los cuartos de sus hijos, con el propósito de crearles sus propios espacios, privacidad y evitar el hacinamiento.

Anteriormente, ha recibido financiamiento de parte de Pana Pana, lo que le  ha permitido ir reparando poco a poco su vivienda, antes era de madera ahora es de concreto, la ha repeñado y pintado, mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia al vivir en un lugar seguro.

Su sueño es seguir apoyando a su familia, especialmente a su esposa quien se encuentra enferma y requiere trasladarla a Managua para que la operen  y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Albaro is a young optimist from the city of Biliwi.  He’s 27-years-old, married and has three children who attend school very enthusiastically.  He’s been employed at the city hospital for 8 years and has been able to improve his income level and access Pana Pana loans.  He’s requesting this loan to do home improvements.  It will be used to provide separate bedrooms for his children so they can have space of their own with privacy and no overcrowding.

He’s received Pana Pana loans before which have made it possible for him to gradually repair his dwelling.  It used to be wood and now it’s cement; he’s sealed the walls and has painted it thus improving is family’s quality of life by living in a safe place.

His dream is to continue supporting his family, especially his wife who is ill and needs to be moved to Managua for surgery, and to move his children forward.

loans.use: to build bedrooms for his children and avoid overcrowding.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn (in the photo), age 23, is a garment worker. He lives in a Phnom Penh suburb and he just has one young son. In addition, his parents are living with him. 

Chanthorn wants to buy a motorbike to get to work because he does not have his own transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Gerardo Oswaldo

texts.es:
Gerardo, tiene la necesidad de invertir capital para darle mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte (moto taxi), comprara llantas nuevas, le hará cambio de aceite y otros. Todo esto es con el fin de dar un mejor servicio y brindarles a sus  clientes una mayor seguridad en sus recorridos.  Con el crédito anterior mejoro la unidad de transporte, aumento sus ingresos con lo que pudo pagar sus cuotas y brindo un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Está motivado por adquirir una nueva moto taxi, y así seguir apoyando a su hija en sus estudios, brindarle lo necesario en su hogar.
texts.en: Gerardo needs to invest capital to service his vehicle (mototaxi).  He will buy new tires and change oil and others.  He does all this aiming at providing better customer service and increased security on his trips.  He used the previous loan to improve his unit.  His income increased so he was able to make his payments and he provided better service to his customers.  He’s motivated to buy a new mototaxi and to continue to support his daughter’s schooling and to provide everything necessary at home.

loans.use: to buy new tires and service his vehicle.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es originaria del municipio de Waspam, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene siete hijos, todos asisten al colegio. Ella envía remesas para la manutención de su hija  mayor que está estudiando en una universidad de Managua.

Desde hace tres años estableció su tienda en la sala de su casa, con apoyo de su esposo, lo que le permitió comenzar con una pequeña mercadería compuesta por media docena de pantalones, una docena de camisas y media docena de zapatos. 

Con el propósito de mejorar su negocio, decidió solicitar financiamiento en Pana Pana, el cual fue aprobado y lo invirtió en mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, adquiriendo vitrinas, mantenedora y estantes  y establecer su propio local para su tienda. 

Actualmente solicita un nuevo préstamo, con el objetivo de diversificar los productos de su negocio, los cuales comprará en la capital y ofertará a precios accesibles al público. 

Ella quiere continuar apoyando a sus hijos, particularmente a la mayor con sus estudios universitarios en la capital. En el futuro, aspira a comprar y vender cosméticos que se distribuyen por catálogos.
texts.en:
Maribel, 34, is from the municipality of Wespam.  She’s married and has seven children all of which attend school.  She sends stipends for her oldest daughter’s support who is attending university in Managua.

She opened a store at home three years ago with support from her husband.  She was able to start out with a little merchandise consisting of half a dozen pants, a dozen shirts and half a dozen shoes.

Aiming at improving her business, she decided to request financing from Pana Pana and it was approved.  She used it to improve her business’ condition; she bought display cases, storage and shelving and set up her own locale for the store. 

She’s currently applying for a new loan to diversify her stock merchandise.  She will buy it in the capital and will sell it to the public at affordable prices.  
She wants to continue supporting her children, especially her eldest with her university studies in the capital.  In future, she hopes to buy and sell cosmetics via catalog.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sokkhim

texts.en:
Sokkhim, age 46, is a garment worker. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh and she has four children. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. 
Sokkhim has requested a loan to add to her own money to buy a motorbike for her son to get work because he does not have his own transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son commutes to work.

loans.name: Bunthuon

texts.en:
Bunthuon, age 32, is a garment worker. She has been married since 2001 and she has two children - one son and one daughter. She lives in a village about 20 kilometres from Phnom Penh City. Her husband is a soldier. 

Bunthuon is applying for a loan to rebuild the house where she lives.

Photo: Bunthuon is pictured at her mother’s home, not her home.

loans.use: to rebuild the house where she lives.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor, ha decidido solicitar otro crédito para invertir en su cultivo de maicillo y frijol. Comprará abono, herbicidas, semilla (maicillo y frijol), también comida para el ganado que posee. El capital que se le facilito anteriormente le ayudo al aumento de su cosecha, mejoro sus ganancias.
Al mejorar sus condiciones económicas el apoyo que le brinda a su familia es más estable, permitiéndoles una vida más  digna.
Hasta el momento no se le ha presentado ninguna dificultad familiar, de salud o en su negocio que le impidan seguir luchando para salir adelante.
texts.en: Víctor has decided to request another loan for his sorghum and bean crops.  He will buy manure, herbicide and seeds (sorghum and beans) and also feed for the cattle he owns.  The capital he got previously helped him increase crop yields and his profits rose.  By improving his economic condition he’s able to provide more stable support for his family providing a more proper life for them too.  To date, he’s had no family, health of business problems arise that would keep him from continuing to strive to move ahead.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Njau

texts.en: Njau is a father of 4 and a volunteer community leader and mobilizer in most community-level empowerment programs.  His village of Kauru in Mbeere District sees him as a great asset.  Recently he was appointed by the community to head their water sources protection committee.  He is also the chairman of a community empowerment and cultural promotion group that works to promote community health and awareness on preventive diseases.  Njau wants to offer his bike to the community in order to facilitate ease of information-sharing forums which will increase awareness of pertinent issues affecting the community, especially on health and water conservation.  The motorbike will also help him generate some income to take care of his children and wife.  Njau adds, “Kiva has made my dream come true as I have always wished I could get a means of serving my community faster and wider.”

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to support community health work

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, tiene 28 años está casada pero por el momento se encuentra separada, vive con sus dos hijos de 11 y 4 años. Desde hace un año se dedica a tiempo completo a su venta de tortillas, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado.
Al  momento no ha tenido ninguna dificultad para el manejo de su negocio, María solicita un préstamo para comprar mesas, sillas, utensilios de cocina, etc., que le servirán para instalar un comedor en el local que ya tiene y así ampliar su negocio.
Todos los esfuerzos que hace son con el propósito de generar  más ingresos, aumentar el número de clientes, cubrir las necesidades de su familia. El sueño que tiene es ver a sus hijos como profesionales y que tengan una vida con menos limitantes.
texts.en:
María, 28, is married but separated at the moment.  She lives with her children who are 11 and 4 years old.  She’s been working full-time in her tortilla business for a year; her shop is located in a market.

To date, she’s had no difficulties with managing the business.  She’s asking for a loan to buy tables, chairs, kitchen utensils, etc. to set up an eatery in the locale she already has to expand her business this way.

All her efforts are focused on generating more income, increasing the number of customers and to cover her family’s needs.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals and have lives with fewer limitations.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, kitchen utensils, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 34 years of age, managing her own business. She has a piggery business in their back yard, which serves as her main source of income. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 per head. At present, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feeds and vitamins for the pigs. She hopes for additional income this time in order to save for the future needs of her family and her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase for more stocks of clothing.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits and processes bill payments. She lives in Serang, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Eka is married.

Eka began working with Ruma five months ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $46 - $50 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

Recently, she took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur 34 years old, married and has two children. His family live in the house which the state has given them as refugees. Eight years ago, Zaur has started his own business. Previously, he worked at a school as a master but his salary did not allow him to fully maintain the family's needs. 

After remembering the skills taught to him by his father, he decided to open his own workshop. Now he repairs vehicles. In addition, in front of the garage he wants to open a teahouse. So far, his clients are served tea in the workshop which creates some discomfort for him and his customers. For this reason, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 700 AZN. With the teahouse separated from the workshop, he can confidently and without hesitation continue his work with quality and professionalism to repair the machine.

loans.use: to separate the tea-house from workshop.

loans.name: Aleksi

texts.en:
Aleksi, 64, is from the village of Ruisi. He lives with his wife, daughter, son-in-law, three grandchildren, and retired mother. Aleksi has a fruit and vegetable business, and owns a stall at the local open market. He says that he has many regular customers, which gives him a good income. He is a very hardworking man, with a great desire to ensure his family members with proper living conditions. 

Aleksi has requested this loan to purchase a van and use it in making product deliveries. Aleksi will continue his trading business and reduce transportation costs. He will generate good income to satisfy the daily needs of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a van and use it in making product deliveries.

loans.name: Jhunu

texts.en:
Jhunu is a 47-year-old woman living with her husband, son and daughter in a small village of Odisha, India. She has been engaged in the activity of selling bangles at a nearby market for the last two years.

She is planning to open a ladies’ cosmetics variety store, and for that, she needs some financial help. She hopes it will be very helpful to earn some more income so she can manage her family's expenses smoothly.
 
She has requested a loan amount of 10,000 INR (Indian rupees) for purchasing cosmetic items and new designs of bangles, so she can increase her customer base. She wants her son to complete his graduation from a good college and to save some money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic items and new designs of bangles.

loans.name: Odmaa

texts.en:
